Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: harshv
Reviews.Content: Well located, not too far from the lake or the magnificent mile...good, comfortable rooms and met my expectations in most respects. Wifi was expensive, and very poor speeds Didn't eat at the hotel restaurants so can't comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott quality, brand new property”
Reviews.Author: jmp1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property in May, 2011 and again in January, 2012. I love that this is a brand new property. Everything is new, clean, and modern. This location is really good if you are arriving via train and there is a major L stop right outside the front door. I'm used to staying at the other end of Michigan Ave. so I'm getting used to the location. I find the rooms next to the elevatorhave the most spacious layout. It was noisy at all due to the layout. Yummy illy coffee Ianthe lobby but it's really pricey. There is a Duncin Donuts and Starbucks right out the front door at the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: CynthiazMequon_Wi
Reviews.Content: I treated myself to a lovely stay at the JW in February! The word lovely describes everything and everyone at the hotel! The staff was so gracious and delighted to assist you in any way! My personal fave was the fabulous flavored water in the Lobby-kudos to the person who created citrus peach!!!! I cannot wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not quite excellent”
Reviews.Author: ElaineAndGreg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this JW Marriott twice, for a total of 4 nights. My experience has been pretty consistent. I like hotels in historic and older settings and this is a recently renovated structure, which is a plus. The lobby is large and opulent. The rooms, too, were well-appointed and had a "luxury feel", including LCD tv's, wide molding, granite countertops etc. The sheets on the bed were of a high thread count and very soft. The staff was friendly and attentive. So why not excellent? Well, a couple of things. First, although I paid close to $300 a night after some sort of preferred rate, I still had to pay $15 for wi-fi. Really? I'd pick an internet connection over a TV or many other things in the hotel. It sure as heck doesn't cost them anything close to $15 for a night. If you are a Marriott platinum or some other high level "elite", the internet doesn't cost extra, but I travel all over and, frankly, while it is generally very good, Marriott isn't always the best alternative so I don't have the high elite levels needed for "free" internet access. Second, I thought the prices in the restaurant and the lobby were rather high. The prices for wine by the glass were more than I would pay for an entire bottle at home. They are certainly entitled to a fair profit, and I support their right to one, but $18 a glass for wine that would cost $12 a bottle retail is going a bit too far. Having said that, I had a chocolate martini at lounge bar, an occasional indulgence for me, that was very good (it was $18.50 with tax and tip). In short, they have a beautiful and thoughtfully restored building and an excellent and responsive staff. I was annoyed, however, by the nickel and dime-ing on things like excess charges for internet access and beverages in the lobby. If you are already Marriott elite of a sufficient level, the internet won't be a problem, but you would likely be staying here anyway. If not, however, I would look at the entire package to determine whether the hotel is worth it. I'd leave it up to you.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line hotel”
Reviews.Author: sojo65
Reviews.Content: I was staying here for one night and I have to say that it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at in my life. I got a Double bed room (because they ran out of the rooms with King sized beds) and the room was extremely spacious and quite. Bathroom was also amazing. A nice sized tub with a shower and double sinks. The best part of my stay was the service. Everyone working at the hotel was extremely nice and courteous. I left an important folder in the room when I checked out and I called few hours later and they were incredibly helpful in finding it for me and holding it until my business was done for the day. Overall a 5-star experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: John_and_Seth
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the JW Marriott on a recent weekend trip to Chicago. I'm a Marriott Rewards member and have stayed at tons of Marriott properties all over the world. I was a little hesitant to stay at the JW Marriott Chicago because of the location in the financial district, since I was in town for pleasure/dining/shopping. However, once I stepped in the door I realized I made the right decision. First of all, the staff are impressive. Everyone from the valet, doorman, front desk and concierge went out of their way to welcome us (and continued to make us feel welcome throughout our stay). Genesis Rodriguez at the front desk was awesome. The concierge also was amazing (sorry, but I didn't get his name). The hotel is only about 1 year old, it was a former bank converted to a hotel. The architects and designers paid close attention to every detail, in the common areas and guest rooms. I upgraded to Luxury Suite, and as you can see from my attached pictures it was top of the line. I would easily stay here again on my next trip to Chicago. I didn't even mind the location. It was only a quick 5 minute, $5 cab ride to the Magnificant Mile and Navy Pier. I'm sure the this hotel caters to business travelers Sunday-Thursday, so it's a quiet on the weekends and you're more likely to score a great rate. I would highly recommend the JW Marriott to anyone visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “True Luxury”
Reviews.Author: NCGuys08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend. The hotel is a few moths old and is in magnificent condition. We stayed in a suite and the room was clean and kept very well. There are 4-5 ppl in the lobby just greeting guest coming in and leaving. Did not eat in the restaurant as there are so many places around to eat. My only negative is the staff that answers the phone. I called 3 times for wake up calls, once to have food tray picked up and none of the employees used my name or were friendly in manner. For a JW they should be as top notch as the lobby staff. The concierge recommended a great burger place as well and was very friendly. Would definately stay here again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “This felt like visiting wealthy family.”
Reviews.Author: seaskyhopper
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago for my daughter and her best friends 10th birthdays. The staff were amazing, they treated the girls like total princesses, even sending them complementary cookies to the room on their birthday. It is nicely situated and easy to get to most things within Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel just a little far away from everything”
Reviews.Author: aa6nz
Reviews.Content: On a day shopping trip to Chicago we stayed here for one night in room 829. The room was very nice...very modern furniture and comfortable bed, huge flat screen with HD and nice wet bar and small fridge. The bathroom is huge and has marble floors with a glass door, Grohe shower head and jetted tub. The water closet is separated by a sliding in wall door. The lobby is huge and very nice, the door men and valet parking are very professional and friendly. They always greet you when entering or leaving the hotel. However the valet parking is $ 55.00 ouch...but very efficent and friendly. They have a bar in the lobby that is very nice and huge. I had a double expresso which was ok but it was'nt hot enough for me at $2.00 a shot. It was Lilly expresso straight from Italy so I don't know what the problem was. The service was excellent, as was everyone we delt with at this hotel. There was security there at the hotel but very discreet. One thing I noticed is that Saturday night was party night at the hotel and even though we were on the eighth floor and facing the inside court yard, we could still hear the thumping of the music from the party that night. Also, the sound proofing between rooms was excellent... I could'nt hear a peep between rooms. However, I could hear every conversation in the hallway right outside my room door. I heard every person coming back that night and what they were saying. They may have been a little loud but I thought this lack of soundproofing on the room door was odd. I have stayed at the Pennsiular and Trump in Chicago and the JW is as clean as both. But their locations are much better and are overall (duh!) a upgrade above this hotel. But since Our stay was on points ....It was very nice. I would stay here again on points but not paying because its location to Michigan Ave and shopping is not as centrally located as the other two hotels. P.S. Wi-Fi was free for me.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service, beautiful rooms, great bar with a nice cocktail selection and very tasty menu. Always enjoy our stay here- th”
Reviews.Author: Aimeeyso
Reviews.Content: Top notch service, beautiful rooms, great bar with a nice cocktail selection and a very tasty menu. Always enjoy our stay here- the staff will go out of their way to help. Wish all hotels were as lovely as this.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy”
Reviews.Author: kykiminhongkong
Reviews.Content: Excellent comfort. Rooms are small. Located in financial district so quite a walk to Michigan avenue. Service eas very good at the hotel. Amazing dAy spa!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value, rooms are small, horrible wifi signal”
Reviews.Author: Cmack717
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding and after 3 days of trying and retrying, they couldn't figure out and adjust the right promo price for the room, the room was tiny with no view, and the wifi is very weak and in most places doesn't work. I like to use the FaceTime feature to stay in touch with kids back home and was told even after paying for the stronger guest wifi signal, it would not work for wifi. If you're staying in Chicago, definitely go for the Sheraton or Westin instead!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night while traveling on business in Chicago. I was really impressed. The hotel has a great location in Chicago's loop -- lots of restaurant options nearby, close to public transportation, etc. Despite a late arrival (11p), as soon as my cab pulled up to the door, a doorman was unloading bags from the cab and escorting me inside. An associate at the front desk instantly helped me. Check-in was fast and flawless. The hotel is gorgeous -- it's decor is classically elegant, but it feels modern, as it maintains clean lines and neutral colors. The lobby is spacious. The hallways are elegant, with artwork of Chicago landmarks (actual artwork, not just framed posters or photograph), wood paneling, etc. Best of all, my room was perfection. It was spacious. It had an incredible comfortable bed with high-end linens. It was equipped with great technology for the business traveler -- USB charging ports, plugs everywhere (on the desk, next to the beds), VGA cables to attach a laptop to the television, etc. The desk had a very comfortable chair and great lighting. There was a grand entrance with a large closet equipped with plenty of hangers and nice robes. And the bathroom!: a shower, a separate water closet, a deep-soaking tub, two sinks, and a television in the mirror. The decor, like the lobby, felt modern but still luxurious -- everything, from the carpet to the furniture to the curtains, was high-end. I was very impressed with the quality of the facilities and the service, and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff at beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: snoopy0201
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a conference, and I was quite impressed! The room was beautiful and modern, the bathroom was quite large and beautiful as well. Plenty of closet space, and very comfortable beds. The staff was also impressive, as they were quick to assist with anything needed. I could not find my information to print my boarding pass, so I needed to get into my e-mail. The lady at the front desk gave me her keyboard, turned her monitor around, and let me get into my e-mail from there, rather than making me go pay for internet service. The staff members go out of their way to assist the guests, which is wonderful to experience. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: andy1225
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this property. It was one of the nicest Marriott hotels I've stayed in. Room was flawless, clean, very well appointed. Staff was helpful, polite, professional and helpful. Bed was big and very comfortable. I've stayed in many hotels in Chicago and this is the nicest one I've stayed in. I'm changing my future stays in Chicago to this hotel, I've found my new home. Anyone finding flaws with this property would be very, very picky.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Exceptionally Clean, Modern Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Silverwaveman
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott brand is a notch above your regular Marriott. This is a luxury 5 star hotel. This hotel has very professional staff, extremely clean and luxurious rooms, very spacious modern bathrooms and simply the most comfortably linens. Marble is abundant in the bathrooms. The rooms have large size Iphone/Ipod docks, large screen TV's, nice carpet and high quality furniture that could easily accommodate a long stay. Closet space is more than adequate for 2 people for a longer stay. The bar downstairs has a great drink selection and a very warm welcoming atmosphere with pleasant and very professional bartenders. The staff knows a lot about Chicago and will answer your questions about where to go/what to do even if you know quite a bit yourself. This hotel has a very sophisticated yet warm and home like atmosphere. Please understand, it is not the absolute biggest or best of what Chicago has to offer, but it is very unique in it's own way and very welcoming. It is located in one of Chicago's most historic and oldest buildings to provide that old world city charm. It is the type of hotel that you want to come back to time and time again and call it home away from home. The room service menu is very extensive (dinner and lunch) are very reasonably priced for a hotel of this type. Due to the location of this hotel, please do not expect a great view, just an OK view. It is located in a historic building that over the years became surrounded by other taller ones. If you want a street view, you will have no problems getting it you reserve your room by phone in advance. Just like ALL the other hotels in this class, breakfast is not included in the price but again, it will be delivered to your room and the prices a very reasonable for a hotel of this level. The hotel is very close to your major conveniences: Walgreens, Starbucks, Cafe's, Restaurants and etc. Some reviews complain that is it not close enough to the 'shopping central' on Michigan Avenue and etc. It is really not fair to judge this way and most people who stay at this hotel do not have shopping as their #1 priority for the day. Please check the map before you book. This is foremost a sophisticated professional/business/luxury hotel and it is for that purpose in an ideal location...the center of the financial district. If you want a 5 minute walk to the Water Tower and Michigan Avenue shopping there is a regular Marriott on Mich. Av. for about $100 less. However, this JW is not that far of a walk to Michigan Avenue shopping if you are a fairly fit and not lazy :-) If anything, a maximum 5 minute cab ride to Water Tower. Not so negatives but just pointers for future guests and management. Wi-Fi is not complimentary No slippers for after bath/shower For the price, this hotel is without a doubt a winner and worth boking if you haven't stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott on Adams”
Reviews.Content: This property is 1 year old and absolutely beautiful. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpartyUSA
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a weekend of shopping and fun. Although we looked at a lot of hotels, we stayed here because we got a great rate. The rooms are really nice. Comfortable beds, nice linens, etc. The bathroom was huge. Nice glassed in shower, large separate tub, nice appointments. The only downside was that it is not close to shopping and much of the area is not open on weekends. I understand this is due to the fact that it is in the business district of Chicago. The EL station is close by and you can always take a taxi. This is a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Details Lacking”
Reviews.Author: rkalish12
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the JW Marriott in Chicago on Adams Street, which is in a great location in the heart of the financial district. The hotel is beautiful, as was the room albeit a bit small. Unfortuantely I experienced a few small mishaps which was an inconvenience for this quick business trip. The first was while doing a quick cleanup after checking in to see that the mouthwash foil seal was broken. The second was jumping into the shower in the morning and realizing that I was left no shampoo. I called the operator and politely asked if someone could rush it up which she said yes to, however that took almost 30 minutes. Minor complaints but disappointing given this being a flagship property.

Reviews.Title: “JW - excellent hotel, modern and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Ctrigg1
Reviews.Content: JW is a top notch hotel, beautiful rooms, great room service, nice fitness center. Have a spa on site but never been. Always a great stay. Comfortable beds, marble showers with large separate soaking tub. Located a downtown with a short walk to State St. A little further to Mag Mile for shopping, quick cab to most anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “JW Must Be Proud, Exceptional Hotel, Great Visit, Why Go Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Clinton S
Reviews.Content: What a surprise to find this hotel so nice. I loved the room layout, albeit a little on the small side, but nicely decorated, good quality materials, and tasteful. It is a very comfortable hotel, clean and fresh. I asked if it was new to find out it opened after a complete renovation about a year ago. Seriously, I will look at rates on my next visit to Chicago, but there is no reason to stay anywhere else. Service was very good, the lower level lounge nice, gym very nice...I have found a home when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at the JW Marriott was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: KitinIowa
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed over the Thanksgiving weekend at JW and found the staff thoroughly delightful from the telephone agents to the front desk all were welcoming and helpful. They allowed us to upgrade to club access with our Gold status and had free wifi. Had an interior room on the 11th floor that was smallish but well maintained and a friendly helpful maid. Had a very nice rate too as it was a slow time of the year for the hotel. Looking forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Traveler Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior124
Reviews.Content: Almost everything here is perfectly tuned to meet the needs of the business traveler. Fast wifi, great fitness center, wonderful executive lounge and excellent staff. Always my first choice when coming to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Service was horrible”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel has no pool. Our experience with the staff including the hotel managers (Maureen), restaurant manager Stephanie, and other front desk staff was very unpleasant. The managers are very inexperienced and have little knowledge of customer service. Even though the hotel itself was nice, but we're extremely disappointed with the service that we received during our stay. For instance, someone in the kitchen messed up our breakfast order and they blamed it on other hotel guest writing on our door-knob menu without our knowledge. What a bunch of ridiculous excuses! In addition, the breakfast orders were made wrong and Stephanie the restaurant manager didn't have the intelligence to even understand the issue besides overlooking the mistakes and finding excuses for her staff. Maureen the hotel manager never stepped up either. Also, the front desk are unfriendly and they would not answer phone calls for over 2 mins. Mind you I called very infrequently, This has to be absolutely my WORST hotel experience ever and the WORST JW Marriott ever. The staff is just horrible !!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and classy hotel in the loop”
Reviews.Author: 2tampuh2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night to relax in the city. The hotel is in the loop so expect a ten minute walk if you plan on hitting Michigan Avenue. The hotel is beautiful and the lobby is one of the best I have ever seen. Beautiful marble, chandeliers and staircases were very impressive. I found the staff to be friendly but disinterested and they would not honor my request for a room with a king bed, instead I received one with two fulls, not a deal breaker but a little disheartening. The room was beautiful, white trim, modern new decor but very elegant and classy. Exactly the luxury you would expect from a JW. Linens were superb and the bed was very comfortable. We had a decent view West and could see the El (but don't come here if all your looking for is views of the city, there are none). The bathroom was perfect. Separate toilet area, a huge soaking tube, large separate glass shower, double vanity, and lighted mirrors. Perfect hotel if you want to ditch the Michigan Avenue crowds but still require some luxury, its nicely tucked away and quiet but I was nearly tempted to crash one of the weddings going on in the grand ballroom. Lived up to JW name for sure but staff could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal Says - Service - Service - Service”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the same price as the Marriot Lincolnshire - see my review. The difference is it is 60 miles and a world of difference away. I checked in and the person at the desk said that I could upgrade for $40 to the executive floor. I did and what a difference. I got there and they began with a welcome, used my last name immediately. I had an issue with the internet and they not only spent 10 minutes with the service people but comped the internet for 2 days. The food is great on the floor as is the view. The rooms on the top floor are roomy and spacious. The furniture is a great mix of modern and traditional and it works. The bed is fantastic after such a miserable one in Lincolnshire it was just a delight. The location is perfect for the museums or bus to Miracle Mile. It is 2 blocks from the northern train line and 2 blocks to the O'Hare train both much better ideas than a car or taxi. The concierge was perfect in making a dinner reservation, how to get to the Museum of Tech and Science and the fact there was a special night at the Planetarium and walking directions there. I travel 120-150,000 miles a year. Good hotels with great service are few and far between. This one is excellent. The reason it does not get 5 stars is it is important that you know the Executive floor closes at 11Am on Friday and does not open till Sunday Evening. This is just a bad idea in that the floor was full all weekend and the ability to just relax with a muffin or a snack and some tea is worth it and closing it on the weekend is sort of down scale for such a nice hotel. This location is 1 year old in a 100 year old banking building and just done very nicely. The W hotel is across the street and the rooms are smaller and the lobby not nearly as useful or tasteful as the JW. At $200 a night it was a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facilities, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DisneyJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott this past weekend. The rooms are absolutely fantastic as was the Staff running the Hotel and the Banquet Staff in their Grand Ballroom. Very clean and well laid out rooms. We also attended a Wedding Reception in their Grand Ballroom and the Banquet Food, (which can often be considered ordinary at some facilities), was excellent. The service staff was buzzing around the room with patience and speed. Of course some of the guests, (that often got in their way), not once did I see a frown or agitation of any kind. The guests were having a wonderful time yet the plates, dishes and glasses kept coming and going without interuption. The Banquet Manager orchestrated the dinner perfectly in my opinion. The only negatives with this Hotel was the arrival and how absolutely busy West Adams street was. This is a narrow city street with another Hotel directly across the street and with Guests arriving at the same time to both Hotels, some traffic control would be welcomed to those first time visitors. We also had breakfast at the Florentine. Again the service and the food was excellent. It is not an inexpensive stay but in my opinion travelers often get less than we pay for. In this case, the JW Marriott gave the guests more than what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “A must when traveling to Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many of the downtown/Mag Mile hotels in Chicago. I would have to say that the JW is definately in my top 3! We took the train in to the city for the Holiday Festival of Lights ( make it a point to do this at least once! ) and I was pleasantly surprised how close the JW is to Union Station, Just a five minute walk. It is a beautful new hotel ( it was formally a bank in the financial district ) with an exceptional staff who bent over backwards to make sure we were well taken care of. The room was very comfortable, nicely decorated and clean. I am a bit of a bathroom snob. If I don't like the bathroom, I am not going to like the hotel. Well...that was not going to happen here, it was awesome. There was a huge shower, separate extra deep soaking tub, generous marble sink with a make-up area and a TV in the mirror. There were many little extra's in the room that made us feel really pampered. We loved it! The biggest surprised had to be Sunday morning. Figuring it would take the typical 45 minutes to a hour for room service we placed our order. We were told it would take 30 minutes...great! 10 minutes later there is a knock at the door from a very cheerful staff member with our breakfast! Not only was it super quick, it was hot and very good. It was a bit pricey but room service at any good hotel in Chicago is. In short it was a great stay. We will certainly be going back and will recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Put this one on your short list”
Reviews.Author: JHFIII
Reviews.Content: This JW Marriott is excactly one year old. I've stayed there three times since it opened. The rooms are very comfortable and the staff friendly. It is centrally located in the heart of the financial district. One minor annoyance for me is the pervasive "techno" music which is just a bit too loud. I did ask that it be turned down in the Florentive Dining Room and was successful. My wife also finds the room cleaning a bit below the mark. She pointed out that they don't seem to actually mop the bathroom floors (does any hotel?). If you are particular about cleanliness, bring your can of comet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: KurtBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very quiet and discrete, ideal for fussy business traveler. Wide open ,formal, elegant lobby (not warm and inviting however), beautiful rooms with incredibly spacious marble baths. Very comfortable rooms. Great gym! Best concierge/club level food,service and surroundings that I have experienced yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, quality hotel, no view”
Reviews.Author: mcxl5
Reviews.Content: Extremely high level of service offered by the JW staff, as the other poster said, from the valet to the doorman to the front desk. Very efficient check in and clean room. The only issue was that I requested an exterior room. The even numbered suites face the interior which gives you nothing to look at and very little sunlight. Unfortunately the staff said most of the exterior rooms do not have king size beds which I find hard to believe. The overall experience was great though and extremely good value for the JW experience. Despite being in the middle of a financial district, it was still within walking distance to everything you would want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: maureen c
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for my granddaughter's wedding. The accommodations were absolutely fantastic but the best part of the stay was the wonderful staff. Everyone from the doorman to the front desk, the restaurant staff and the maintenance staff were so friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room”
Reviews.Author: pickyguyMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Small room with no seating other than a desk chair and two small ottomans. I checked in for 3 nights. I thought I had reserved a room with a king bed, but apparently the bed size was just a request and not guaranteed. I was given a room with two full size (not queen) beds. I complained and was offered a king bed in a room on 5th floor overlooking the atrium. The front desk staff did disclose to me that the window was opaque, so there is no view, but I still agreed to take the room given that I really wanted more than a full-sized bed. After 3 days with no view at all to outside, I decided I should have taken the room with the small beds and a real window. The hotel did give me a free internet/entertainment package given they could not meet my room request, but that didn't do much for me because I am here on business with little free time to watch movies and an expense account to cover internet access. The bathroom is spacious with high end finishes. They could have used more square footage for the room and less for the bathroom. The finish on the desk was chipped off, making it look shabby relative to the rest of the room. One light fixture was mounted too close to the wall to allow the light shade to fit properly, and the seams on all the lamp shades were turned out. An admittedly minor detail. Exercise room itself, located in the basement , was nothing special, but the equipmenjt was plenitful and as high end as you'd find at any health club. I didn't use the restaurants. As you would expect, room service is very expensive (e.g., $19 burger + tax and delivery). Staff seemed pretty accomodating. I probably would have had few complaints had I been placed in a room with a queen or king bed and a real window.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; Indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: CarkIt
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent--tasteful design, restful colors, and clean--and the beds were comfortable. The bath was spacious with both a deep tub and a shower. No complaints with the facility. The only drawback to our stay was the indifference of the staff. While check-in was efficient, the clerk was bored and robotic. No hello. No thank you for choosing us. The same was true of checkout. No questions about the stay. No thanks for staying with us. Only the valet was moderately friendly. These seem like small concerns, and in the scheme of things, they aren't monumental, but for a boutique experience that the JW Marriott markets itself to, there are better, more hospitable, offerings in this price range. PS. Don't expect a view.

Reviews.Title: “perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ChampneTastBeerPockt
Reviews.Content: stayed fri-sun on a short pleasure trip. check in went smoothly. beautiful lobby/lobby bar area. the rooms are enormous! double sink which is convenient. soaking tub & tall oversized shower. i prefer to have a hotel with a view of lake michigan/navy pier..but this location was minutes in a cab to shedd aquarium and michigan ave etc. dunkin donuts next door. would def stay again (even tho we had absolutely no view from our room)

Reviews.Title: “Good business stay”
Reviews.Author: CLL29
Reviews.Content: Nice Marriott hotel. The rooms were comfortable and bathrooms finished out nicely. Hotel adjacent to el train but I never heard it. Restaurant is pricey for very small portions - food was ok. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “The best bed!”
Reviews.Author: EBoultbee
Reviews.Content: I transferred to the JW Marriott in the loop area of Chicago after being at a conference about 30 minutes away. The building is beautiful and the standard rooms were large, spacious and beautifully appointed. The bed was fabulous - as the Marriott beds tend to be and the linens were of a great quality. The bathroom had a separate loo and shower. The Magnificant Mile was a short taxi ride away as we're most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...........”
Reviews.Author: Yo H
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here at the JW. It was a day after Oprah had her guest for her finale. Nice room with a good view. The hotel is grand and beautiful. Unfortunately, we thought there was a sauna and spa room at our disposal at any time. We later came to find out that was not the truth and we were very disappointed. After a long day of shopping and walking the Magnificent Mile and beyond, we needed to relax our way. Unfortunately, the entire area was closed for the night and not really opened during the day. The spa is owned separately and the JW has no control or idea when the employees would be there. I got a brochure ahead of time before I got there, and it was misleading and I was misinformed. We met several other guest that were disappointed and lost trying to find the spa. We all found it locked and totally inaccessible. They attempted to compensate us for this loss, but it did not really do the job. We travel and we expected certain things to be as stated, this was not the case. To add, the place was a former bank and wee were informed, they were still under construction. Mind you there is NO pool

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: christopherpee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, new hotel in an old building. Large rooms, great service, full-size gym. Heavenly beds and bed linens, terrific bathroom, great location. what more can i say?

Reviews.Title: “Would be back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: ostrich_v
Reviews.Content: Handy location, tasteful decor (including nice artwork in the rooms, instead of the usual trite crap), and great service! Unfortunately, we got to sample only breakfast at the restaurant, but if that was indicative of the overall quality of the food & service, it's highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: Lronn H
Reviews.Content: The JW is an outstanding hotel. I really enjoy staying there. The facilities are great. The gym is great (there are spots where the lighting could be better). I really enjoy grabbing a quick meal at the bar. The only poentially negative comment is that the restaurant is very noisy so it is difficult to have a dinner and discussion.

Reviews.Title: “Very sharp hotel in great Chicago location”
Reviews.Author: Raymundo4855
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here in early September 2011. The place is a new rennovation of a old bank building. What a great hotel experience. The lobby gleams and has several cozy spots to hang out with a cool bar. The staff from curb through check in and concierge were genuinely friendly and interested in assisting guests. The rooms are very nice with everything new and massive bathroom. Outstanding stall shower and great bathrobe, I purchased one. We ate at the main restaurant and did room service breakfast, both were great. The location is excellent for business or pleasure. Right down the street from the Art Museum and the Willis tower is a couple block walk. One side of the building baces the noisy loop so make sure if on that side you are up at least the 10th floor. We found the pricing here competitive with other lesser hotels in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and awesome location - will come back”
Reviews.Author: HM106
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what we were looking for when we arrived to Chicago. The decor is beautiful, the staff is really helpful and gave fabulous recommendations, the hotel is in a very central location..oh, and the bathrooms are huge! The rooms are a little small and I think the beds are a little smaller than your average double queen beds though-- maybe a full? But all in all it was a great hotel. The location is perfect too-- you'll also find a Dunkin Donuts and Walgreens right around the corner. Oh, and the Sears Tower...right behind us :) Will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “The nicest Marriott I've seen”
Reviews.Author: cincytraveler123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is georgeous. Everything from the lobby to the rooms to the bar. First class all the way. Expect to pay Chicago loop prices for rooms and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous weekend”
Reviews.Author: Retiredtraveler07
Reviews.Content: My friend came out to visit for a spa weekend and my daughter recommended we try this hotel. The hotel was beautiful. The rooms were gorgeous and so so nice. It was worth taking cabs to Michigan Ave. to stay at such a wonderful place. The staff was so courteous and super friendly. The fellow who helped us get our cabs was so extremely nice. The food at the Florentine was delicious. When I arrived home from the weekend, I realized I forgot my make-up in my room. I called the next morning and the person who worked in lost and found was very helpful. He said he would go across the street immediately and fed ex my makeup back to me. I got it the very next day. My husband and I are going downtown in December. We will definitely be spending the night at the JW Marriott

Reviews.Title: “Went way out of there way”
Reviews.Author: loveitallx6
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the beds are beautiful and perfectly appointed, just a great city hotel. We also like being away from the noise of Michigan Avenue. The staff were impressively accommodating! We showed up with kayaks on our vehicle and the valet matter of factly told us that they would not last five minutes on our car if we parked it in an outdoor lot. (The underground secure lot could was not high enough). They suggested storing them in the bellman's closet and proceeded to haul them through the lobby, all with enthusiasm at that. When we went to leave three days later they had already mounted them back on our car!!! Never have we had such over-the-top valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ChilliO
Reviews.Content: Expect excellent service from the time you check in through check-out. Staff always courteous, friendly, and knowledgeable. The large quiet room was much nicer than most hotels and was an exterior room (recommended). Had a wonderful dinner at the Florentine restaurant but the food and drink choices at the lobby lounge were very good as well. Kudos to Linnea for being a quick and friendly server in the lounge; I liked her enthusiasm for the hotel as well. I would definitely stay at the JW Marriott in Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dtanpcs
Reviews.Content: I like the location and amenities. If you are focusing on Marriott properties, it is worth the difference in cost to the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: steener100
Reviews.Content: I believe this hotel had been open only a few weeks when we stayed there over a weekend in late May, 2011, so everything was still pretty much brand new and sparkling clean. The rates are fairly high, but not out of line for a hotel of this quality in a prime downtown location -- an easy walk to all the major business and shopping destinations, including the Magnificent Mile. Most impressive was the service - very friendly, very customer-oriented. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new financial district hotel”
Reviews.Author: daddyo-2
Reviews.Content: Great property with a very attentive staff. Property is new and in very good shape - from the lobby to the conference rooms to the guest rooms. Very clean and bright. Staff was very friendly - someone greeted you pretty much every time you came into the property - liked the lemon ice water in the lobby as well. Rooms nicely furnished. Located right in the financial district so not much to do in the immediate area (except work) but only 10 min by cab to Miracle Mile or a 15 min walk to the park and lake. Great French Toast in the dining room but a limited breakfast menu and no breaskfast buffet like you would expect

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding; incredible service”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: This is a great property and it service is top notch. It is well staffed and their staff are not scripted but instead are very customer oriented. Newer and cleaner and bright rooms greet you. Excellent room service; strong bar selection; front desk staff very customer oriented; room and area markings very easy to follow. This is perhaps the best property in the Loop

Reviews.Title: “Just okay in my view.”
Reviews.Author: mpwineca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a converted bank building and looks like it. The lobby is oversized and unwelcoming despite the opulent appointments. The room I had was adequate but oddly shaped. It was converted to fit the space without regard to how it might work as a hotel room. I had a great view of a parking lot and the air conditioning equipment. Not interested in coming back despite its excellent location. Very sterile environment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rainydayinnyc
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, well appointed JW. Rooms appeared recently redone and the bathroom was quite large. I will ding it a star for having an ice cold lobby, the most confusing maze of hallways known to mankind, and a less than impressive response to me mistakenly taking a bottle out of the mini-bar to look at it (they have one of those sensors that charges you automatically, which I realized once the bottle was in my hand since the sign wasn't too obvious. The woman at the desk acted like I committed a felony despite the fact that I called within 30 seconds of it happening. She seemed very put off that she had to send someone up to verify the stock in the minibar because I was an idiot. Granted, they were sold out, it was Lollapalooza after all, but I think we still deserved what is usually a high level of service from them. Or at least the benefit of the doubt. There was a pool listed in the amenities and on maps, but apparently it wasn't completed yet. That was a disappointment. This is a good location if you're travelling on business, but a bit of a hike from the shopping and restaurants, so take that in to consideration if you're going on the weekend - there isn't much near the place at all, and it gets a little sketchy after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great upscale hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: Jonipreston55
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for the weekend of Chicago Eats and we loved the location. The amenities were like a four seasons (they had a spa and really nice restaurants) and it was very central to everything in the city. I would definitely choose this hotel again for its location and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of quiet in busy Chicago”
Reviews.Author: 4snickers
Reviews.Content: Always love the Marriott brand as every time we stay we usually have a great nights sleep, this time it was a bit hit or miss, as room service food dishes were piled up in the halls for sometimes as long as 8 hours..Breakfast included was only room service or in the lounge area..even if they didn't bring another hang tag for you door..how did we know? So they got us for a 45 dollar breakfast in their regular restaurant...Overall the service was good, concierge knowledgable, parking a bit of an issue as had to wait 30 mins to get our car...and confusion among those folks...even though they charge $45 per night for your car to stay..you would think service would be spot on...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilk2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the J.W. the last week in August and I am happy to report, after much research, was more than satisfied with the level of service we received at this hotel. The rooms were nicely decorated, clean and fresh, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Apparently, the hotel renovated an old bank building and only have been open since last November. The black out curtains are great, and even though we were facing Adams (on the 11th floor) and close to the "L" train, the windows were double paned so we did not hear any city noises. Tina, one of the front desk employees made our trip extra special and took the time to really personalize our stay. Our girls loved seeing her smiling face and showing her what they chose from American girl. We have traveled a lot and by far, this has been the most favorable experience with a front desk person ever. Manager of JW Chicago, if you are reading this, give Tina a big raise!!!! She is what hospitality and service are all about and we will return to this hotel. The cleaning staff were friendly and were not so loud as to wake us in the morning. (this may have been a slow week, but we didn't really hear them at all) The valet guys and bell hops and all the staff always had a smile and greeted us every time we entered/left the premises. Location: This hotel is in the financial area (loop) but it is really not that far to walk to Michigan avenue. In fact, we found the location ideal for shopping on State street (where Filene's basement, TJ Maxx, Nordstroms clearance -off the rack, and other general stores were located. We also liked that we were only a short walk away from Grant Park/Chicago Art Institute. We walked home from the Field Museum/Shedd Aquarium which was about 15 minutes or so. We also walked a few times to the Magnificent Mile shopping area and this was also no problem. We are city people so the walking did not bother us at all. But, you can take a cab and it will cost only a few dollars to get to the Water Tower area. (home of American Girl and other great shops) The Federal Reserve is just around the corner from the hotel on LaSalle and it has an interesting little museum which is free. The Willis (Sears) Tower is only about two blocks away. We took the Chicago double decker buses and stop 10 is right across the street from the Willis Tower. You can hop on and hop off the bus all around the major attractions of the City. We extended our pass for three days and took the other tours as well. The North Tour will take you to the zoo, botanical gardens and home of the cubs. (all worth seeing) We paid 87 for two adults and one child. (they let our youngest go on for free due to her age) If you have not gone to Chicago, take the tour, it is worth the information you will receive about the city and it serves as a great way to get around. Since the hotel is not on the main strip, you do have to walk a bit to find area restaurants, but there is Giordano pizza which is only about two blocks away and their pizza was recommended and enjoyed by us. We also had sandwiches for lunch at Hannah Bretzel which were amazing. (organic, tree hugger type restaurant with "uber" sandwiches and high prices. But they did have gluten free bread so I am bias) Right outside the hotel was a deli like restaurant called the potbelly pig which also made delicious sandwiches which our kids enjoyed. Also the Corner Cafe made great brunch/lunch food. Chicago is kind of a bread loving city. We had room service and the food was delicious. The banana cheesecake was very yummy. At night, the hotel is in the quieter area since it is the financial core, but it was safe to walk around. The W is located across the street from the JW. The Cons: Valet was 52 a day which is expensive and the internet is not free. But, with that said, the positives outweigh the negatives. If you stay here, you will not be disappointed with the hotel itself. If you are only interested in shopping prada, gucci etc, then I would suggest you stay at a hotel near the Water Tower area. This was a great hotel and we will return, in large part because of the friendliness of the staff and cleanliness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “big room, great fitness center”
Reviews.Author: nycnd
Reviews.Content: Bathroom in my room was as big as any Ritz I've stayed in with deep soaking tub and large glass shower. Fitness center was as well-equipped as most full-on gyms. They even had my favorite: kettlebells. Only downside was it was in the lower level of the building so no outside views. Alex at the front desk was extremely helpful. Concierge lounge was nice with a helpful staff, a nice little conference room, and tasty treats and breakfast. Overall a very friendly and professional staff across the board.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: robbem
Reviews.Content: Our room (1065) was great except for the noises, of unknown origin, that were made the whole weekend. The room had a foyer and lots of room (a private toilet area with a frosted glass door to insure privacy) in the bathroom area as well. Upon arrival and departure we had a bell person that was out of this world, the help he provided about he hotel and the surrounding area was "spot on"!!!!!! The restaurant in the hotel had this french toast that I swear was heaven sent, and the room service was too good to be true!!!! This hotel is well worth a visit for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: PK6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and with my family in August. It is a gorgeous hotel. Rooms are very comfortable. The bathrooms are luxurious. We had adjoining rooms for my kids to share; worked out great for us! When my kids goofed up and took stuff out of the small refrigerator in error, the front desk promptly sent up a free small refrigerator to use for our sodas. My husband and I used the workout room in the basement every day. It was really good...lots of top-notch equipment. My daughter got a massage in the spa. Although it didn't compare with some other top hotels in quality, she enjoyed it. Location of the hotel was perfect....we walked all over Chicago from Navy Pier to Michigan Avenue. The food at the hotel was delicious that we had for the conference. Conference rooms were elegant. Finally, the service all over was superb. My kids really appreciated how friendly Jose' was in the lobby, and the front desk people were wonderful. Highly recommend this hotel for business and/or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in a convenient part of the city”
Reviews.Author: Ski_Bum
Reviews.Content: Everything was terrific at the hotel, and for a business trip, they provided all the needed services and more. We ended up renting one of the meeting rooms on the third floor, and they took care of all our needs. My only regret was not taking advantage of the 24-hour gym.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best business Marriott I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Jordan7T
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum member with Marriott and this is one of the best. Gorgeous rooms, bathrooms and incredible gym. The service was awesome and staff is very friendly. Very cool lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Florentine restuarant ...beware”
Reviews.Author: chicagovisit8511
Reviews.Content: My wife and I dined at the Florentine 8/5/11 in the JW Marriott Chicago and they poisoned her. She stated she is a celiac patient and requires a gluten free diet. The chef came to the table personally and said he can prepare any pasta dish gluten free with his special "farro" pasta. He was wrong. On the back of the pasta package it is stamped, "This product contains wheat ingredients". She was violently ill that whole weekend and still afterwards. They charged us $150.00 and ruined our vacation. It looks like to me they do not know what they are doing. Nick & Urszula Warren Mi

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Marriott I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: nomadic4fun
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel that was apparently finished at the beginning of 2011. My basic room had a huge bath and a separate marble and glass shower. The wet bar was the nicest (and most expensive) I have ever seen. The hotel gym was great (but it seems like all big city Marriott gyms are the best in the hotel industry). The staff were a 10 on a 1 - 10 scale. My only complaint is that the interior rooms only have a view of other interior rooms (see photo).

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME PROPERTY!”
Reviews.Author: StevenVA
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel - every attention to detail has been covered. The Concierge Lounge staff is wonderful and so welcoming. I will stay here again on my next Chicago trip!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CheeseMouse
Reviews.Content: I was most impressed by the staff at this hotel, the service was more than I have come to expect at a large chainnhotel. This hotel is located in a part of downtown surrounded by offices, so the "neighborhood" gets very quiet and empty when the business day ends. I had a room with 2 queen beds, it had a decent workspace and enough room to move around comfortably. My room faced in to an open outdoor space, no view for me, but it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, well located, great staff”
Reviews.Author: BoomerWoman
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a large, elegant hotel often used by conferences, because it has so many meeting rooms. A friend and I met in Chicago just to go to the Blues Festival, and loved it. The staff treated us like royalty, the hotel appears to have been nicely renovated very recently, and the location.... about 6 blocks straight west of the Art Institute, can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: kessman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and centrally located. The staff were all so polite and seemed sincere about helping you. The only downside is the cost. Not just of the rooms but of everything from food to the business center. If that is not an issue, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully done...”
Reviews.Author: jennifersunshine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is newer and has spacious rooms and the bathroom is HUGE! The bathroom was our favorite with a separate room for the toilet, marble flooring, and the glass enclosed shower was brilliant. The customer service was impeccable. Although it is a bit of a walk to magnificant mile, it was a welcome walk after filling up with food and drinks. My tip for Chicago downtown: If someone says let me show you something with your shoes...do not let him polish the shoes. We did, and when he told us how much money we owed him, he became belligerent. We did not see any police around, handed him money quickly, and were on our way quickly! I was really rude to anyone asking for money afterwards, and said the begger before them blew it for him/her! Not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worth The Cost”
Reviews.Author: StaySimms
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights before he left for a deployment, and he's already talking about staying here again when he gets home. From the moment the valet helped us get our luggage from our car, the staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. The entire hotel is beautiful, from the lobby, to the rooms, to the hallways. We got a room with a king bed on the 5th floor, facing the front of the building. It was great to see all the hustle and bustle without hearing it, but we had to make sure to keep some of the curtains closed, since we were level with business offices. Other than that, the room was phenomenal. Everything was very spacious and top notch. I enjoyed a soak in the deep bath tub. The location is great too. We were about a 10 minute walk from a major train stop, about a 10 minute walk from Willis Tower, and about a 10 minute cab ride from Navy Pier(we didn't hit any traffic). We found it easy to get anywhere from the JW. Lastly, the fitness center was great. we had many choices of cardio equipment, free weights, and weight machines. It was very clean and up to date, and I enjoyed working out there. The price is fairly high to stay here, but for what we got and the convenience the location afforded us, we WILL be staying here again when we visit Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but excellent”
Reviews.Author: FreqFlyer2011
Reviews.Content: Pricey compared to other hotels right around the corner, but you get what you paid for. Pros: Everything is sparkling new Wonderful Italian restaurant on the premise Eye candies in the lobby bar during Happy Hour and late into the young night! First rate rooms Cons: It's more of a Marriott thing, but why can't they offer free Internet in their rooms? No StarBucks on the premise

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hou_architect
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW for Neocon in June. I had a regular room, which was lovely. The bathroom was generously sized with a large marble shower and double sink granite vanity. No tub, but I didn't miss it. The hotel underwent a total renovation recently, and the money shows. Definitely up there with the better hotels in Chicago. Not quite a Peninsula or Park Hyatt...but close! My colleague upgraded to a suite, and I tell you, that's where the rubber meets the road. The bathroom was as big as the bedroom, and it had a big Wow factor. There was a freestanding tub clad in marble mosaic tile, big marble shower, and a toilet in it's own room. The vanities were separate, so no leaning over your spouse to reach the toothpaste. But the big WOW factor was the mirrors. They were both large, with the lighting seamlessly integrated into the mirror in a clean band of white light. The best part - when you turn on the tv, the picture appears in the mirror facing the tub. Way cool. I liked the fact that the hotel is next to an L stop, since I was way over the taxi cab drivers who floor it between stoplights for their own entertainment. One MAJOR drawback was the $15 a day charge for Wifi. Really??? These days, in my opinion that's like charging you extra for soap. All the major low and medium chains offer free Wifi, and for a high end hotel to charge for it is a major irritant to the business traveler. Other than that, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A fun time in CHI-TOWN!”
Reviews.Author: momof5grls
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great! Housekeeping has many OCD personnel as all our cords were neatly wrapped & tied every day. Our things on the sink area were placed orderly on a washcloth for cleanliness & our things in the shower were lined up neatly on the ledge. The tub was a small swimming pool! Ha-ha! My shorter adult daughter was not allowed to go in without a lifeguard. Within several minutes walking to many sights & amenities. Florentine restaurant on site, with Iron Chef Todd Stein, has food to die for! Friendly and helpful staff at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lobby Bar is a Lobby not a bar”
Reviews.Author: trader2011
Reviews.Content: I work at the board of trade and have visited the hotel several times with friends. Staff is always friendly, knowledgeable and engaged. Cocktails are always consistent and delicious but the menus are in very much in need for change for both food and beverage. Being a regular from the start I have noticed lots of great staff have left, lighting still remains way to bright (reason it is more of a lobby than a bar) very little ambiance for such a luxury property. Lately in the evening lack of management presence on the floor with no follow up on quality or even a hello. Could be a great bar is some of the little things change which have been mentioned on comment cards each time I or friends visit.

Reviews.Title: “Platinum treatment”
Reviews.Author: Jawfixr
Reviews.Content: As a plat Marriott member, we were treated like kings. Definitely the best chicago hotel for Marriott elites, at least. For the rest of y'all, see what you're missing out on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: caymanfvr
Reviews.Content: Less than six months old and it shows.... Nice clean property. Very open lobby and lounge area. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were a decent size for Chicago, bathrooms were large and had everything you would need. Food at the hotel was lacking a bit, there was only one restaurant, an Italian one on the second floor or you could order off a limited menu in the lobby lounge area. Breakfast in the lounge area that they promoted consisted of pastries, fruit cut or yougurt parfait and was excesively expensive for what it was. You could get a cooked breakfast at the Italian restaurant. The sauna at the spa was pretty nice, they even had an infared sauna that I tried out and enjoyed. The gym was incredible and had everything you could ever want. Equiptment had HD tv screens and complimentary headphones. For some reason my bill had a $56 charge for parking? I was on business and when left, used taxis... they didnt give me an explination for why that charge was applied but were quick to remove it when questioned! Overall a great property and I would stay there again if visting the city. Great job JW....

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBeth
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been nicely remodeled, the lobby is large and nice and the hotel had one of the better fitness rooms I've seen. Parking was expensive (typical Loop prices) and they charged for wireless internet (16.95), a pet peeve of mine.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and lacks the elegance of a JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: 828SSE
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Platinum Elite member I was pretty disappointed. The hotel rooms are well appointed, but small. The bed is the same great Marriott bed I have come to know and appreciate. There are no views to speak of, but if you know the location that comes as surprise. The lobby, bar, and check-in desk are noisy, boring, and too close together. The JWs I have stayed at were substantially more elegant. At $375 a night for a basic room go some where else like the Marriott Blackstone on Michigan or the Hilton on Michigan. FYI: As of this post the Pool was not opened. $52 per night for parking

Reviews.Title: “Stole our Kindle; Didn't clean the Room; TAKE VALUABLES WITH YOU!”
Reviews.Author: WantCheaprFastrBettr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is committing robbery by charging these prices when you figure in that they stole our brand new Kindle from our van when they parked it in their parking structure (THIS while charging us $52 a night to park!). As if that wasn't bad enough, they didn't clean our room after our first night (nor did they re-stock the drinking glasses or shampoo/soap). We were vacationing over the Memorial day weekend with our kids so this was very disappointing to them as well: we didn't get the chocolates we're accustomed to! Of course, the worst part to the adults is the thievery of the brand new Kindle... just received as a 50th b-day present for my husband! I'm MORE than angry!!! Will never stay here again.... Pool isn't even usable yet. If you DO stay here and pay the exorbitant fees for parking, TAKE YOUR VALUABLES WITH YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Well Appointed.”
Reviews.Author: BixUS
Reviews.Content: Here for an overnight business trip. Never got to see the city but the hotel was quite nice. Just refurbished with top notch furnishings. Indoor pool not open yet. Has a spa. Catered food was good, but uninspired. Valet parking? 40+ dollars day....

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not the best for this price range”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: Since this is meant to be a 5-star property, I was slightly disappointed. On the plus side: * Brand new property * Good location - in the Loop, 2 blocks next to Sears/Willis Tower * Comfortable bed * marble & wood bathroom - somewhat standard for this class * Separate glass surrounded shower area and a very large bath-tub * Concierge person was helpful On the negative side: * On the shower wall, a few small spots of mold/mildew - surprising for such a new property - their house-cleaning needs to be more thorough * Some tiny pieces of lint on the bench next to the bed - again surprising for this class of hotel * The bedroom - while not tiny wasn't especially large either * Since it's an old building, my room looked out on the inner "courtyard" with not much view. At a lower price level, this would be a great hotel. But at this price level, I would have expected more thorough cleaning & maintenance. I liked Chicago though - felt a lot less crowded than other cities I have been recently.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Staff, Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: rvp1919
Reviews.Content: This was one of the better Hotel experiences i have ever had and I travel a great deal. The staff goes above and beyond to make sure you are comfortable and happy. The rooms were clean and a good size for Chicago. The hotel was in perfect condition, the rates reasonable and i would highly suggest staying here for any occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Well done JW Marriott, well done.”
Reviews.Author: Theens
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time in Chicago and a lot of it focused on our terrific experience at this hotel. Check in: Emily checked us in and was so friendly and welcoming. While the appearance of the hotel is formal, the whole staff made us feel more like family than formal guests. This is such a distinction from the Ritz-Carlton or the Four Seasons. We really felt like we were coming home, but to a much more upscale home most hotels. Concierge: Faith really made our stay unique. We donâ€™t usually seek help from the concierge, but she was great so we're glad we did. She gave us a map and pointed out places to see and areas that were good for runs. She also was VERY patient with us and got us some great reservations for dinner. The Florentine (onsite Rest): Faith booked this for us and sure enough, it was another great experience. The fact that the chef had just been on Iron Chef was a special treat and the food and service were really top notch. The Room: Wow! I want this room to be my home. It had such a luxurious feel to it and was so comfortable. The bed was super comfy and it was so clean, spacious, and beautiful. The dÃ©cor was very modern yet classic and one felt like you were in a very high end hotel. The only fault we found here was that there was quite a bit of hall noise that was heard in the rooms. Overall, our stay was really remarkable. It was not only the location and property itself, but the staff that really went above and beyond and made our stay so memorable. We fell in love with the city of Chicago and plan on returning often (especially since Faith couldnâ€™t get us in to so many of the restaurants we wanted to try). With that said, Iâ€™m pretty confidant that the JW Marriott will be our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, friendly service with decent lobby bar”
Reviews.Author: MAElizabeth_S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to attend a wedding reception. Requested early check in and our room was ready at noon. Staff very helpful and friendly. Hotel is very close to mass transit. We took the train from Midway airport and it was a four block pleasant walk from our stop. Had lunch and a drink at the lobby bar and the food was pretty good. Only small downsides- we tried to nap in the afternoon and the 8th floor was quite noisy with people coming and going, doors slamming, people talking loudly in hallway. It wasn't a problem that night. The other downside- the honor bar in our room was jammed and when we finally got it open two items shifted and we were charged for them. My husband took it up with the front desk and they immediately removed it from our bill. Overall a lovely Marriott property with elegant, clean rooms and a sparkling lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiminCinci
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the JW Marriott this weekend while we were in town visiting friends. Beautiful lobby, nice open bar area and there are a few onsite restaurants (we didn't try them). The hotel staff was very friendly, always asking us how we were enjoying our stay, asking us if we needed help or had questions about the hotel. I was very surprised with how spacious, modernly designed, and upscale our room was. I wanted to move in and live there! Very high quality bedding, furniture, decor, door handles, etc. I was really impressed. My two critiques of this hotel were the location (it is probably better for business travelers who want to be close to their office or client locations). All restaurants in the area either close early, or aren't open on the weekends, so that was a bit painful. The other critique is the cost of the minibar items. Probably the most expensive I've seen ($9 for M&Ms?). All in all, a really nice hotel and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Typical JW Experience and Quality”
Reviews.Author: 4RealBeach
Reviews.Content: Was surprised to hear negative reviews on cleanliness... makes me think something was up that week. Everything was very clean and very comfortable. Was checked in quickly by staff and quickly went up to our room. Room was large for chicago standards (although Renaissance rooms on Wacker are a better choice if room size is your main criteria). We had room service that night. Menu was typical for a hotel - they offer 24 hour room service which is somewhat unique, though. Service was prompt and as ordered. They are going the high-tech way with the television/entertainment. Many of the things you select are internet based. They have on-demand in addition to pay-per-view which is a nice touch that I've not seen at other properties (Marriott or otherwise). Valet is not cheap (you are in Chicago) but car was available quickly as needed. Lobby bar is a bit impersonal, but drinks were good. Unsure what the smell is, but smells like perfume. A little strong, maybe, but oddly felt more like a Vegas hotel lobby. Felt special the entire time I was there. Staff went out of their way at every turn to ensure we were taken care of w/o being over the top. We are typical Renaissance hotel people when we are in Chicago - we avoid the Michigan Ave properties as they are much more crammed and value is lower. The location is a bit farther from Michigan, but we didn't have a problem getting around when we needed to. I wouldn't consider it a factor when I choose to stay here again - and I will. With the Reniassance, Blackstone and JW, Chicago has several great properties to choose from now.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a health inspector”
Reviews.Author: conjuror88
Reviews.Content: JW Marriot Chicago is a beautifully appointed hotel , sliding doors open to the wrong side ? The lobby is bright, clean and the staff look bored. It is located in the financial district so the restaurants are closed on weekends. Magnificent mile is a good 30 minute brisk walk. I attended a conference . The rooms are small,new furniture sufficient enough. Bathrooms are nice, with the mirror bordered by florescent lights, great , white lights and the counter has dotted led lights which is great at nighttime. Toilet was not cleaned properly since there was some fecal residue on the sides, called the front desk. Next day we were missing some toiletries and towels, hair clump on the shower -front desk again, The cleaning time is not consistent since when I came back after lunch the room was not yet done. When calling for anything it takes a while for them to pick up like 5-7 rings. I have stayed at the Marriot before for medical and business conventions, but this hotel is sub par in terms of room cleanliness. DId not try the restaurant Florentine since it was empty we walked to Magnificent mile. In terms of location, it is a poor one especially if you have limited time after all the meetings and CME's. Prefer the Magnificent Mile marriot location was perfect, cleaning was better and so was the staff. Would not reccommed JW to anyone. There are better hotels in the same echelon you go go for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and fancy hotel, lobby and bar. Standard rooms small. Staff friendly.”
Reviews.Author: KollegeKlubMadison
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful. The food is average. I ordered room service twice for dinners. Each time it was "skimpy" at best. They got the orders wrong both times. And I ordered directly from menu without any variations. The food that did come was delivered lukewarm or cold. And usually they make room service a nice presentation, but i guess at this hotel you just get the basics. (for example, i ordered a cheeseburger one night with a salad. The burger was dry and overcooked too welldone, the fries came cold, the salad was missing things on it that the menu said it had, and they were just too generous to send a single small bottle of catchup instead of a couple. Very basic, no table cloth and a lack of presentation) The rooms were very nicely decorated, but the standard room i had was small. Bathroom was clean and with good amenities. Spacious bathroom. The pool is still not ready, it has been about a year I think. Fitness center was impressively large. Overall i would probably stay here again as it is a nice hotel in good location. Staff is very helpful with directions and anticipating needs. I think management just needs to focus on consistency and delivery standards for service.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel Facilities / Bad Inconsistent Service”
Reviews.Author: schia48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days for business conference meetings. Long hallways that wraps around... with lifts on one side. You will get lots exercise, if you happen to have rooms on the far side from the elevators. First of all, the internet is SLOW and really sucks, as it only allows you to have one device connect at a time (with their annoying log in/log out service). That means, if you use your laptop to do some emails, you cannot use your PDA/iphone/ipad to do anything else. All that hassle, and they charge you USD14.95 per day.... for slow crummy broadband internet. Otherwise, you can opt to pay USD19.95 for "faster" access. The gym is located on the basement... no windows!! :-( Supposed to have a heated pool... but will not be opened till November 2011 it seems. Compared to other Marriot Hotel that I have stayed (especially in Asia) the housekeeping is horrible. For one, they do not clean your room at a consistent time. Most days, they do not even clean the room until 6pm. Even when they do... the end up missing to refill all the bathroom amenities and one day, did not even refill the coffee / sugar / plastic coffee cups. Next day (after complaining to front desk) they end up piling on all the coffee & milk, but forgotten the cups and water. Even on a "good" day... they still forgot to the bathroom floor towels. This is the worst housekeeping for a Marriot, I have experienced - no excuse for a 5-star hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on the Loop - Very Romantic”
Reviews.Author: KalyanParker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend New Year's Eve in Chicago. While we enjoy touring the different areas (and neighborhoods) of Chicago, we generally gravitate towards the Loop when staying in a hotel since we enjoy taking advantage of Amtrak. Union Station is only a couple of blocks away, which is great walking to/from the hotel. The JW Marriott just opened last year, and it is magnificent. The lobby is warm, clean, and very inviting. The bar has an excellent choice of beers, and for whatever reason the deserts were outstanding (you normally don't think of eating deserts while drinking at a bar, unless you are my wife). The service in the bar was extremely attentive (and all the cocktail waitresses were very attractive - don't worry - my wife said all the guys working at the bar were also attractive). The room was very modern and comfortable; including the bed. The bathrooms was very spacious and bright; our bathroom had a separate toilet room, a soaker tub, AND a walk-in shower. And last, but not least, the room service was fast and immaculate. The attention to detail was just incredible. It literally felt like they had three employees for every guest in the hotel. This was the best part of the JW Marriott - the employees being ready to assist. We felt like we were at a five-star hotel off the Champs-Ã‰lysÃ©es in Paris. You know how in the movies they show all the hotel employees running up to help a guest struggling with their three carts of luggage? That's what it felt like. And that's why we had an incredible romantic evening in Chicago for New Year's Eve. We will definitely be going back this year for New Year's Eve.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: joeyp51
Reviews.Content: very pleased with the location and amenities of this hotel. my view was nice and the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again and again!”
Reviews.Author: Linda7240
Reviews.Content: Two night stay at the JW with a friend to just "play" in the city. Service was outstanding from valet parking to departure. We did not dine onsite but did get a tour of the spa and wish we had more time to use those facilities. Rooms were soundproof and comfortable. Bathrooms in the standard guest room were incredible. We only live 40 miles away but will return to what will be a world class hotel in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Stay”
Reviews.Author: jahjay62
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chicago J.W. Marriott in mid March 2011. The hotel was exceptional. The hotel was beautiful and well appointed. The rooms were large and luxurious. The fitness center and spa were outstanding and one of the best that I have seen. The hotel location was convenient to a lot of the museums and tourism sites. If you take the train from the airport, the Orange line stop at Adams/Quincy is adjacent to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: michigantraveler1961
Reviews.Content: I went to Chicago for a weekend and stayed here. The room was outstanding, especially the bathroom, which had a huge soaking tub. The staff was friendly and the free fitness room was more than adequate. Like all pricey hotels, there was a charge for internet, but as a Marriott gold member, I did not have to pay. My only complaint is that the cable TV was out for quite a bit of time (on Superbowl Sunday). But the weekend price was a great deal, and I would highly recommend the hotel for a peaceful getaway. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights and found the room to be wonderful. Check-in was quick and efficient. Even though I arrived at 10 a.m. they had a room ready for me. I am a platinum rewards member andf was given a room on the executive lounge level. The view from the room was of the interior rooftop so not very exciting, but the room itself was well-equipped. I like the electronic mirror with the TV in it in the bathroom ands the deep soaking tub was fantastic. The bathroom had a separate rooom for the toiley, two generous sinks, a bathroom scale, and a nice lit make-up magnifying mirror. There was a spacious closet with robe and a very nice desk. The chair in the room was not that comfortable. The executive lounge was nice and the food served good for breakfast.
