The appetizers one night of my stay all had dairy products in them and since I was avoiding dairy due to a medication I was disappointed. I had one room service meal and they forgot the toast and the cream for my coffee. All in all this was a minor glitch as the rest of the stay was excellent. I was always greeted by the staff whenever I encountered them. They might wish me a good day or remark on the weather but their intent was always to make me feel at home and they did. When I exited the bellstaff was at the ready to call a cab for me--they really displayed excellent customer service. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago. I have stayed in a number of locations in the city and this was not my favorite as far as location. There is a subway stop nearby so you can get anywhere the subway goes.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Par”
Reviews.Author: b1ue1cz
Reviews.Content: I don't believe anybody that works at this property has experienced other JW's. I'd much rather prefer to stay at the Marriott Full Service a few blocks east that is better service, about same quality, and less expensive. (the building was very nice, don't get me wrong) Problems encountered: Valet went MIA when we pulled up. We unloaded our own bags and waited for Valet to take keys. Since lounge was closed, asked for a few extra bottles of water to be sent up to the room.... Never showed. Then, cleaning service in the AM knocked on our door early. I understand it's my fault for not putting the notice of still sleeping. However, what was comical, after answering the door and saying "No Thank you" to service, letting them know we are still sleeping.... the maid fired up her vacuum in the hallway and room next door. Well, my wife and I were forced to get up then unable to sleep. Overall nice amenities, new hotel, but service was WAY OFF for a JW. having stayed at other JW's, this was the same level as a Courtyard, maybe regular Marriott. For a flagship property, embarrassing...Stay at the regular Marriott until they figure out how to run a JW.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy, and the stuff needs more training”
Reviews.Author: AA75
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum Marriott member and although this hotel is very new and clean, the stuff still seems to be a little lost. The rooms are really small, and we could hear every conversation in the hallway. When we arrived the bell boy at the front took our luggage out of the taxi but didnt even offer to bring it up to the room? We experience some problems with our rate during our stay which were due to some missunderstanding, in my opinion the stuff just needs a little more training plus no one really offered an apology or a resolution and basically told me I was a liar... ouch! Since we didnt get much sleep due to the noise I probably wont stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice staff, but management picks your pocket at every opportunity”
Reviews.Author: Jlmcgregor
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Platinum member so I can compare this JW with the brand's hotels globally. The hotel has very nice facilities and a very friendly and efficient staff. But, the Managment picks your pocket. The hotel's wireless is unstable and expensive. It seems each time you sign on with your laptop, iPad and iPhone you are being asked to ante up another $20 for the day. Each device has a separate charge. The concierge lounge doesn't have it's own wireless and the hotel wireless barely leaks into it. Forget any decent snacks or complimentary drinks. They serve very tiny $9 glasses of wine and offer some stale buns and chunks of Gouda cheese. Doesn't add up to the JW brand. I have stayed in much better Marriott Courtyards for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: WOXC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Chicago for a quick 24 hour visit; a very last minute getaway trip a few days before his making an overseas deployment. I am so happy we chose this Marriott. The rooms are amazing, bathrooms amazing, and the staff even more amazing!! We felt so welcome and were treated not with professional friendliness, but like good friends. Brandon & Albert and everyone else, thank you for making our stay so memorable and absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Man0j
Reviews.Content: The refurbished hotel opened in November 2010 and is located right in the heart of the loop. Just next to Willis Tower (Sears) and a hop and skip from Magnificient Mile and State Street. Unbeatable location for both the business and the leisure traveller. The service at the hotel is great and the attitude to service is unbeatable. That they do not provide Wifi without charge in the rooms is a bit of nag but then a small one in an overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Huge Fan of this Luxury Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: PoliStein1969
Reviews.Content: True Luxury Hotel perfect for business and pleasure. Had a great visit. Guestrooms are incredible...loved it. The restaurant - Florentine - Fabulous...can't wait to come back soon...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for business traveler in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 6 times since it opened and it is by far the best hotel I have stayed at for business. From the moment you walk in the door, the staff walks up to you asking how they can help. The rooms are exquisite and modern. The bathroom has a bathtub and steam shower and the mirror actually has a TV built into it that functions as a normal mirror when off. I'm a Marriott Platinum Member and the concierge lounge is the best I've been to in the US without question. This night they were serving lamb chops, salads, a brilliant array of cheeses and breads. Definitely not what you find at a typical Marriott concierge lounge. You can actually eat dinner here instead of going out or start the night off with appetizers and a glass of wine. The staff in the lounge treat you like they are waiters and check up on you often. Breakfast is also very good. The lounge also has a private board room that guests can use for meetings, very rare and handy. However, if you want to go to the restaurant, it is very good, although a bit pricey. Try the mushroom rissotto. The lounge in the main lobby is a nice place to meet after work with customers or colleagues. Attentive staff and decent appetizers. The location in the loop cannot be beat, close to Willis Tower, train station, Daley Plaza, financial district. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganMarilyn
Reviews.Content: This is a new JW Marriott in the financial district. Extremely well done! Had a great room and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great new edition to the business district”
Reviews.Author: zswaps
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night, but wished it was longer. The hotel is brand new and beautifully done. Service was excellent and attentive. The gym is one of the best I've seen in a business hotel, with all the equipment that one would see at a regular gym. The rooms are not large, but sufficient for a business stay, with all the amenities that one has come to expect (coffee maker, wireless, accessible electric outlets, etc.) I would definitely return to this hotel and would recommend it to anyone looking for a convenient location in the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: flyguyuci
Reviews.Content: Stayed a few weeks after opening and was very impressed. Beautiful lobby, wonderful rooms (particularly the bathroom), and great service. Also, very convenient to Sears Tower (or whatever they call it now) and nearby areas. Approaching 5 star quality. I highly recommend for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Just like being at home.”
Reviews.Author: pivy
Reviews.Content: As soon as I checked in, I was comfortable. The set up of the room was great. Everything was there. All my needs were met. Absolutely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Jimvic
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great rooms. Especially impressed with the service. Good location within walking distance of the shopping area. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: atlfamilyof5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a recently remodeled old bank, or so I was told by a few people while we were staying there. The lobby is beautiful and though ours was quite small, the room was very well appointed. It was a great start to our day to have a coffee at the Illy bar in the lobby with Brandon giving us helpful advice. The hotel is within walking distance to the Art Institute and the 'bean'. We had great meals at the Purple Pig, Volare, Avec, and the Publican, Go to the Hancock building at sunset for a drink, wow! The service at the JW was spot on. There will be a pool but it's not finished yet (much to the disappointment of my kids!)

Reviews.Title: “All the great amenities, excellent service, and wonderful atmosphere you expect from JW Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: mrpianoman97
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at numerous other JW Marriott Hotels - and always loving them - I was very excited to try the brand-spanking new JW Marriott in Chicago, and I was not disappointed! The atmosphere upon entering the lobby is one of understated elegance, with marble everywhere. The staff is warm and welcoming, very friendly, and extremely accommodating. The room, while not the largest I've experienced, was comfortable with great amenities, including a large flat-screen TV, mini-bar refrigerator, and iPod docking alarm clock. The bed was very comfortable except for the pillows, but I have yet to find a hotel with pillows firm enough for my liking anyway, so I don't hold it against this particular hotel - they were standard hotel-quality pillows. The bathroom was very nice, with a glass shower and oversized soaking tub. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast, and found the service to be okay. There were far too many staff members for the number of diners, and their "overpresence" was a bit annoying at times (not so much intrusive, but just too many staff members walking around the dining area constantly). They were friendly, however, and the food was excellent. We also ate dinner in the restaurant, and found the service much more complimentary to the atmosphere of the restaurant. The food at dinner was superb! The location of the hotel, while not in the middle of all the Chicago action, was convenient. The orange line train stop is only a block away, which makes getting to the hotel from Midway a breeze, and the bustling shopping of State Street is within walking distance. I find it enormously ironic that two of the reviews for this hotel are dated before the hotel opened. Some of the other complaints included having to pay for internet - this is a standard expense at full-service hotels. The parking cost at this hotel was also very high, which is why we didn't bring a car. Overall, this hotel was very nice, and I would recommend it without hesitation. The minor inconveniences we experienced were just that - minor. They are also likely attributable to them working out the kinks, as the hotel has only been open for a month. Another excellend JW Marriott experience!

HotelInfo.Name: JW Marriott Chicago
HotelInfo.Address: 151 West Adams, Chicago, IL 60604
